item.title: Illegal start

item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[quote=“jbblaze, post:5, topic:268343”]huh lol? this is my code now:

[code]}
{
public int gewaitTimer = 0;
checkgewaittimer = 10;
}
if (checkingge && checkgewaittimer == 0)//refreshes ge

    {[/code][/quote]

You don’t declare anything inside brackets. Declare them outside of any other methods.

item.title: Illegal start
item.dc:creator: @jbblaze jbblaze
item.description:
@jbblaze wrote:

Well Ive been try out a Grand exchange- and I almost got it. But I get one error…
I
llegal start of expression
public int gewaitTimer = 0, checkgewaittimer = 10;
^
Yes i have googled it a million times it involves a missing bracket. But ive tried thousands of diffrent place and areas for the bracket and such. So heres my first part of the code:

[code]}

public int gewaitTimer = 0, checkgewaittimer = 10;

if (checkingge && checkgewaittimer == 0)//refreshes ge

    {
        checkge();
        checkgewaittimer = 0;
    }[/code]

Thats were it is… any ideas?

Read full topic
